meanings.definition: Having a thick, sticky consistency between solid and liquid.
meanings.sent1: The honey was so viscous that it took a long time to pour.
meanings.sent2: The glue dried into a viscous substance that was hard to remove.
meanings.sent3: The viscous mud made walking through the field feel like trudging through molasses.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were viscous, moving slowly through her mind like thick syrup.
meanings.sent5: The viscous lava oozed down the volcano, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.sent1: The thick mud was so viscous that the wheels of the car got stuck.
meanings.sent2: The cold honey became viscous and hard to spread on the bread.
meanings.sent3: Trying to run in the viscous syrup felt like running in quicksand.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed viscous, slowing down as she waited for the clock to strike midnight.
meanings.sent5: The traffic moved at a viscous pace, barely inching forward.
